revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2011}} {{Infobox football biography | name= Bruno Ecuele Manga | image = FC Lorient - May 24th 2013 training - Bruno Ecuele Manga 2.JPG | image_size = 200 | caption = Manga warming up for [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] in 2013 | fullname = Bruno Ecuele Manga<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.efl.com/documents/professional-retained-report-2015-16549-3151378.pdf |title=EFL: Retained list: 2015/16 |publisher=English Football League |page=17 |format=PDF |accessdate=26 June 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161202052144/http://www.efl.com/documents/professional-retained-report-2015-16549-3151378.pdf |archivedate=2 December 2016 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> | height = {{height|m=1.86|precision=0}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1988|7|16}} | birth_place = [[Libreville]], [[Gabon]] | currentclub = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | clubnumber = 5 | position = [[Defender (football)|Centre back]] | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = | years1 = 2006 | years2 = 2006–2007 | years3 = 2007–2008 | years4 = 2008 | years5 = 2008–2010 | years6 = 2010–2014 | years7= 2014– | clubs1 = [[FC 105 Libreville]] | clubs2 = [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux B]] | clubs3 = [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]] | clubs4 = → [[Rodez AF|Rodez]] (loan) | clubs5 = [[Angers SCO|Angers]] | clubs6 = [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] | clubs7= [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | caps1 = | caps2 = 40 | caps3 = 0 | caps4 = 15 | caps5 = 58 | caps6 = 118 | caps7= 140 | goals1 = | goals2 = 0 | goals3 = 0 | goals4 = 0 | goals5 = 5 | goals6 = 4 | goals7 = 5 | pcupdate = 17:04, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalyears1 = 2006– | nationalteam1 = [[Gabon national football team|Gabon]] | nationalcaps1 = 67 | nationalgoals1 = 7 | ntupdate = 1 June 2017 }}
''' Bruno Ecuele Manga ''' (born 16 July 1988) is a Gabonese professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays for Welsh club [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in the [[Premier League]] and the [[Gabon national football team|Gabon national team]]. Ecuele Manga is known for being a tough tackler.<ref name="Bruno Ecuele Manga Welsh Article">{{cite news|title=Who is Bruno Manga? Everything you need to know about Cardiff City's centre back signing from Lorient|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/who-bruno-manga-everything-you-7696921|publisher=Wales Online|date=31 August 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
After beginning his career with [[FC 105 Libreville]] in his home country, joined Frenhh side [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]] in 2006. He played for the club's reserve side and spent time on loan with lower division side [[Rodez AF|Rodez]] but only one appearance for the senior side, before being released in 2018. He subsequently joined [[Ligue 2]] side [[Angers SCO|Angers]], making more than 50 appearances in two seasons before joining [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] in 2010 for a fee of €2.5 million.
He made his [[Ligue 1]] debut with Lorient and went on to make more than 100 appearances in the top tier of French football. He was appointed club captain ahead of the [[2012–13 Ligue 1|2012–13 season]] and remained in the role until 2014 when he signed for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side Cardiff City for €5 million. He spent four seasons in the division before helping the club win promotion to the Premier League after finishing as Championship runners-up in the [[2017–18 Cardiff City F.C. season|2017–18 season]].
Manga made his international debut for Gabon in 2006 and has accumulated 67 caps to date, representing the side at four [[Africa Cup of Nations]] tournaments.
==Club career==
===Early career=== Ecuele Manga began his career in his homeland with [[FC 105 Libreville]], before being recommended to French [[Ligue 1]] side [[Girondins de Bordeaux]] by [[Alain Giresse]] who was manager of the [[Gabon national football team|Gabon national team]].<ref name="union" >{{Cite news |url=https://www.union.sonapresse.com/personnalites-gabonaises/bruno-ecuele-manga-joueur-de-football-14453 |title=Bruno Ecuele-Manga: Joueur de Football |publisher=L'Union |language=French |accessdate=14 February 2019}}</ref> After being involved in the club's preseason fixtures under manager [[Laurent Blanc]],<ref name="union"/> Ecuele Manga made his competitive debut for Bordeaux, making his first start, in the [[2007–08 UEFA Cup group stage#Group H|Matchday Six]], in a 3–2 win over [[Panionios F.C.|Panionios]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Bordeaux fightback flattens Panionios|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2008/matches/round=15119/match=301676/postmatch/report/index.html|publisher=UEFA Official Website|date=20 December 2007|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> However, he never played a league game for the club, and spent time on loan at [[Rodez AF|Rodez]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Foot Transferts Les infos à la mi-journée|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/-/Actualites/-/750000000000000000000000015700|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=31 January 2008|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
At the end of his contract, he was signed on a free transfer by [[Angers SCO|Angers]] on a three-year deal, lasting until 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-actu/2008/06/12/01011-20080612FILSPO00097-ecuele-manga-a-angers.php|title=Ecuele Manga à Angers|publisher=Le Figaro|date=12 June 2008|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406143823/http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-actu/2008/06/12/01011-20080612FILSPO00097-ecuele-manga-a-angers.php|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> There, Ecuele Manga was joined by two Gabonese compatriots, [[Arsène Do Marcolino]] and [[Fabrice Do Marcolino]]. Ecuele Manga made his Angers' debut in the opening game of the season, in a 0–0 draw against [[SC Bastia|Bastia]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Bastia Vs. Angers 0 – 0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2008/08/08/france/ligue-2/sporting-club-de-bastia/angers-sporting-club-de-louest/632386/|publisher=Soccerway|date=8 August 2008|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on 24 October 2008, in a 2–0 win over [[Tours FC|Tours]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Angers Vs. Tours 2 – 0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2008/10/24/france/ligue-2/angers-sporting-club-de-louest/tours-football-club/632467/|publisher=Soccerway|date=24 October 2008|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> On 3 March 2009, Ecuele Manga signed a new contract with the club, extending his deal until 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-prolonge/19469|title=Ecuele Manga prolonge|publisher=L'Equipe|date=5 March 2009|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406141137/http://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-prolonge/19469|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> This came after a series impressive display at Angers caught attracted attention from several other clubs.<ref>{{cite news|title=English eyes on Manga|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11704/4928637/english-eyes-on-manga|publisher=Sky Sports|date=16 February 2009|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Reds track Gabonese youngster|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11704/5740082/reds-track-gabonese-youngster|publisher=Sky Sports|date=2 December 2009|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> In his first season at Angers, Ecuele Manga made thirty appearances, scoring twice.
Ahead of the 2009–10 season, Ecuele Manga was on the verge of joining [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]] in a deal worth €4 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-proche-de-rennes/47530|title=Foot – Transferts : Ecuélé Manga proche de Rennes|publisher=L'Equipe|date=23 July 2009|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406141144/http://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-proche-de-rennes/47530|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> However, the move never happened. Ecuele Manga was absent at the start of the season and his first appearance came in a 0–0 draw against [[RC Strasbourg Alsace|Strasbourg]] on 2 October.<ref>{{cite news|title=Angers Vs. Strasbourg 0 – 0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2009/10/02/france/ligue-2/angers-sporting-club-de-louest/racing-club-de-strasbourg/779314/|publisher=Soccerway|date=2 October 2009|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> In his second game of the season against Strasbourg on 5 March 2010, Ecuele Manga scored the first brace of his career, in a 2–1 win.<ref>{{cite news|title=STRASBOURG VS. ANGERS 1 – 2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/03/05/france/ligue-2/racing-club-de-strasbourg/angers-sporting-club-de-louest/779494/|publisher=Soccerway|date=5 March 2010|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> In his second season at Angers, Ecuele Manga made twenty-eight appearances, scoring three times. While at Angers, Ecuele Manga became an integral part of their defence set up, establishing himself in the first team. He later explained his departure from Angers.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuélé-Manga : "Angers m'a appris que je ne restais pas !"|url=http://www.webgirondins.com/actualite-Arret-de-jeu-Ecuele-Manga--Angers-m-a-appris-que-je-ne-restais-pas-18425.php|publisher=Web Girondins|language=French|date=27 March 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
===Lorient=== During the 2010 summer transfer window, he joined [[FC Lorient]] for €2.5 million, and became a first team regular in [[Ligue 1]] as a replacement for [[Laurent Koscielny]] who left Lorient for Arsenal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Koscielny replacement signed|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11704/6250323/koscielny-replacement-signed|publisher=Sky Sports|date=7 July 2010|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-a-lorient/120852|title=Ecuele Manga à Lorient|publisher=L'Equipe|date=5 July 2010|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406142642/http://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-a-lorient/120852|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> Ecuele Manga made his Lorient debut in the opening game of the season, making his first start, in a 2–2 draw against [[AJ Auxerre|Auxerre]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Auxerre Vs. Lorient 2 – 2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/08/07/france/ligue-1/association-de-la-jeunesse-auxerroise/football-cub-lorient-bretagne-sud/936348/|publisher=Soccerway|date=7 August 2010|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga was soon sidelined after injuring his hamstring in training, an injury that caused him to miss two matches in late-November.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuele Manga aux soins|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2010/11/30/97003-20101130FILSPO00528-ecuele-manga-aux-soins.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=30 November 2010|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> His season was further disrupted in mid-February when he injured his thigh.<ref>{{cite news|title=Coquelin finalement forfait|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Coquelin-finalement-forfait/177870|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=11 February 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> After making his return in a 3–3 draw against [[AC Arles-Avignon|Arles-Avignon]] on 12 March 2011, Ecuele Manga scored his first Lorient goal, in a 3–1 loss against [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]] on 11 May 2011.<ref>{{cite news|title=Montpellier Vs. Lorient 3 – 1|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2011/05/11/france/ligue-1/montpellier-herault-sport-club/football-cub-lorient-bretagne-sud/936691/|publisher=Soccerway|date=11 May 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> In his first season at Lorient, Ecuele Manga scored once in thirty-one appearance for the club.
Ecuele Manga's second season with the club started when he played as center-back in the first-twelve matches (including scoring his first goal of the season against [[Stade Brestois 29|Brest]] on 29 October 2011<ref>{{cite news|title=Match Report: Stade Brestois 29 3 – 1 FC Lorient|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/74480|publisher=Ligue 1|date=29 October 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>) until he was absent through injury and suspension.<ref>{{cite news|title=Audard et Bourillon incertains|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Audard-et-bourillon-incertains/241132|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=5 November 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Lorient sans E.-Manga, Bourillon|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2011/11/21/97003-20111121FILSPO00646-lorient-sans-e-manga-bourillon.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=21 November 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> While on the sidelines, Ecuele Manga signed a new contract with the club, extending his deal until 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lorient : Ecuele Manga prolonge jusqu'en 2015|url=http://www.mercato365.com/infos-clubs/lorient/lorient-ecuele-manga-prolonge-jusqu-en-2015-769287.shtml|publisher=Mercato 365|language=French|date=23 November 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> He made his return in early-December, in a 4–0 loss against Montpellier.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2011/11/30/97003-20111130FILSPO00439-cinq-retours-a-lorient.php|title=Cinq retours à Lorient|publisher=Le Figrano|date=30 November 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406152849/http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2011/11/30/97003-20111130FILSPO00439-cinq-retours-a-lorient.php|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> On 17 March 2012, Ecuele Manga scored his second goal of the season, in a 2–1 win over Brest.<ref>{{cite news|title=FC Lorient 2 – 1 Stade Brestois 29|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/74643|publisher=Ligue 1|date=17 March 2012|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Though scoring twice in thirty-two appearance in his second season, Ecuele Manga's agent announced that Ecuele Manga will stay at the club following a re–ignited interests from clubs around Europe.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuele Manga va rester|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2012/05/21/97003-20120521FILSPO00779-ecuele-manga-va-rester.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=21 May 2012|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
At the start of the 2012–13 season, Ecuele Manga was appointed as the new captain of Lorient after replacing [[Fabien Audard]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Lorient change de capitaine|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2012/07/31/97003-20120731FILSPO00384-lorient-change-de-capitaine.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=31 July 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> However, in the opening game of the season in a 2–2 draw against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Zlatan Ibrahimovic helps PSG draw|url=http://espn.go.com/sports/soccer/story/_/id/8260364/zlatan-ibrahimovic-rescues-psg-2-2-draw-lorient|accessdate=15 August 2012|agency=Associated Press}}</ref> Ecuele Manga injured his ligament, and he had to come off, as second half had just started and then it was announced that Ecuele Manga would be out for six months.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuele-Manga, c'est 6 mois|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2012/08/14/97003-20120814FILSPO00472-ecuele-manga-c-est-6-mois.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=14 August 2012|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> After a six months absence, he made his return on 26 January 2013, in a 2–1 loss against [[AS Nancy|Nancy]].<ref>{{cite news|title=AS Nancy-Lorraine 2 – 1 FC Lorient|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/76132|publisher=Ligue 1|date=26 January 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuele Manga enfin de retour|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2013/01/25/97003-20130125FILSPO00697-ecuele-manga-enfin-de-retour.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=25 January 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga then scored his first goal of the season, in the [[2012–13 Coupe de France#Round of 16|Round of 16 of Coupe de France]], in a 3–0 win over Brest.<ref>{{cite news|title=FC Lorient 3 – 0 Stade Brestois 29|url=http://www.ligue1.com/autresCompetitions/coupeFrance/feuille_match/77448|publisher=Ligue 1|date=27 February 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga's captaincy came into question after Lorient lost 5–0 against [[Lille OSC|Lille]] on 7 April 2013.<ref>{{cite news|title=LOSC Lille 5 – 0 Lorient|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/76221|publisher=Ligue 1|date=7 April 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> In response, he reminded himself to take responsibilities as a captain.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuele Manga : "Pas le droit"|url=http://sport24.lefigaro.fr/football/ligue-1/Homes-Clubs/lorient/fil-info/ecuele-manga-pas-le-droit-626726|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=12 April 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> With the sideline kept Ecuele Manga for a long time, Ecuele Manga made seventeen appearance and scored once.
In the 2013–14 season, Ecuele Manga continued to remain Lorient captain throughout the season and captained thirty-three matches out of thirty-five appearances he made. Ecuele Manga scored his first goal for the club on 1 March 2014, in a 1–1 draw against Bastia.<ref>{{cite news|title=FC Lorient 1 – 1 SC Bastia|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/77775|publisher=Ligue 1|date=1 March 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga was absence for three matches, due to a knee injury occurring in late-February<ref>{{cite news|title=Foot Ligue 1 Lorient Ecuele-Manga ne jouera pas|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-ne-jouera-pas/443148|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=20 February 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> and a red card in May, which saw him suspended for one match.<ref name="MangaRedCard">{{cite news|title=3 matches pour Djilobodji|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/3-matches-pour-djilobodji/463152|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=7 May 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> During the season, Ecuele Manga "won 119 aerial duels more than any other player".<ref name="Bruno Ecuele Manga Welsh Article"/>
Having received a red card in his second final game for Lorient, Ecuele Manga was suspended for the opening game of the 2014–15 season for Lorient<ref name="MangaRedCard"/> and after making his return, Ecuele Manga captained once in his three appearance by the end of August. After [[AS Monaco|Monaco]] announced their interest signing Ecuele Manga,<ref>{{cite news|title=Transfert Monaco veut deux Lorientais|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Monaco-veut-deux-lorientais/488871|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=9 August 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga hinted leaving Lorient, quoting: ''"I want to see something else, to have other challenges."''<ref>{{cite news|title=Transfert Ecuele Manga (Lorient) : "J'ai envie de voir autre chose"|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-voir-autre-chose/493993|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=27 August 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> With a one-year contract left at Lorient, there is slim chance for Ecuele Manga leave at the end of the transfer window.<ref>{{cite news|title=Transfert Lorient pousse pour Amalfitano|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Lorient-pousse-pour-amalfitano/493775|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=27 August 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
===Cardiff City=== [[File:Bruno Ecuele Manga 20140916.jpg|thumb|200px|Ecuele Manga playing for [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in 2014]] On 1 September 2014, Bruno Ecuele Manga signed for Welsh club [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] for €5 million, keeping him until 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/article/manga-cardiff-1891826.aspx|title=DEAL COMPLETED: BRUNO ECUELE MANGA|publisher=Cardiff City F.C.|date=1 September 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406163059/http://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/article/manga-cardiff-1891826.aspx|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref>
Ecuele Manga then made his Cardiff City debut, making his first start, in a 1–0 loss against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] on 16 September 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City 0–1 Middlesbrough|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29120662|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 September 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga scored his first Cardiff City goal, in a 3–1 win over [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] two months later on 1 November 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City 3–1 Leeds United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29767130|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 November 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> However, Ecuele Manga was on the sideline after injuring his knee during a match against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] and his international commitment<ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City: Defender Bruno Ecuele Manga returns to fitness|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30446288|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 December 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City manager Russell Slade reveals Bruno Manga could be putting his place at risk after Gabon qualified for Africa Cup of Nations|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-manager-russell-slade-8158477|publisher=Wales Online|date=23 November 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> and made his return for his thirteenth start of the season, in a 3–2 loss against [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] on 20 December 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City 2 – 3 Brentford|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30459342|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 December 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
Ecuele Manga was on the sideline again for his international commitment after being included for the Africa Cup of Nations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/article/team-news-cardiff-vs-derby-2238325.aspx|title=TEAM NEWS – CARDIFF VS DERBY|publisher=Cardiff City F.C.|date=31 January 2015|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406165254/http://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/article/team-news-cardiff-vs-derby-2238325.aspx|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> Ecuele Manga made his return, on 7 February 2015, in a 1–1 draw against [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Sheffield Wednesday 1–1 Cardiff City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31070735|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 February 2015|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga then scored his second goal of the season, in a 3–1 win over [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] on 3 March 2015<ref>{{cite news|title=Rotherham United 1–3 Cardiff City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31597761|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 March 2015|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> and then his third goal came, a week later on 17 March 2015, in a 1–1 draw against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City 1–1 AFC Bournemouth|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31809761|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 March 2015|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga's impressive in his first season led calls for him to be named "Cardiff City's player of the season" by [[Media Wales#WalesOnline|Wales Online]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Bruno Manga is Cardiff City's player of the season and no-one else comes close – Scott Johnson|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/bruno-manga-cardiff-citys-player-8973617|publisher=Wales Online|date=2 April 2015|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
During the pre-season, Ecuele Manga picked up a knee injury resulting in him missing out on the start of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City centre-half Bruno Manga set to return from injury in Capital One Cup clash against AFC Wimbledon |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-centre-half-bruno-9800482 |work=South Wales Echo |date=6 August 2015 |accessdate=6 August 2015}}</ref> Making his first appearance in the [[League Cup]] win over [[A.F.C. Wimbledon|AFC Wimbledon]] and then being dropped back to the bench for the league games that followed. Whilst on international duty in September, he picked up a groin injury and was ruled out for two months.<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City's injured Bruno Ecuele Manga out for two months |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34549550 |work=BBC Sport |date=16 October 2015 |accessdate=16 October 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga made his return to the first team coming on as a substitute for the injured, [[Sean Morrison (footballer)|Sean Morrison]] against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City: Russell Slade slates referee over Birmingham penalty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35137843 |work=BBC Sport |date=18 December 2015 |accessdate=18 December 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Bruno Ecuele Manga 20150822.jpg|thumb|right|Manga playing for Cardiff City in 2015.]] Despite another injury ridden season, Ecuele Manga was offered a new contract by manager, [[Neil Warnock]], which was signed on 27 June 2017.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bruno Manga: Neil Warnock casts doubt over defender's Cardiff future |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39603724 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 April 2017 |accessdate=14 April 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City: Defender Bruno Ecuele Manga signs new deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40421738 |work=BBC Sport |date=27 June 2017 |accessdate=27 June 2017}}</ref> He made a total of 43 appearances as Cardiff finished 2nd in the league, to earn promotion to the [[Premier League]]. He scored his only goal of the season in a 4–1 over [[Mansfield Town F.C.|Mansfield Town]] in the [[FA Cup]].
Manga scored Cardiff's first goal of 2018–19 season in a 3–1 loss to [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] in the [[Football League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 1–3 Norwich City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45254466 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 August 2018 |accessdate=28 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== {{Expand section|date=April 2015}} Born in [[Libreville]], [[Gabon]], Ecuele Manga was called up by [[Gabon national football team|Gabon]] in 2006. In July 2012, Ecuele Manga represented Gabon at the 2012 Olympic Games held in London. However, they were eliminated in the group stage.
